Package cps.mouradalpha.components

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • cps.mouradalpha.components.Broker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManagementCI, ManagementImplementationI, NotificationCI, PublicationCI, PublicationImplementationI, SubscriptionImplementationI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentServiceI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredI, java.rmi.Remote
    public class Broker
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
implements ManagementCI, PublicationCI, NotificationCI
    The class Broker implements a component that provides ManagementCI , PublicationCI and NotificationCI services, it requires also ReceptionCI and NotificationCI services
    Author:
    Alpha Issiaga DIALLO / Mourad TOUATI

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createTopic​(java.lang.String topic)
      Create a topic by adding it to the list topics. the part that is responsible for the creation is synchronized hence only one thread can this method at the same time. once the topic is created it notify the other brokers.
      void createTopic​(java.lang.String[] topics)
      create topics by adding them to the list, it call the createTopic with a single topic behind the scene
      void destroyTopic​(java.lang.String topic)
      destroy a topic by deleting it to the list topics. the part that is responsible for the destruction is synchronized hence only one thread can this method at the same time. once the topic is deleted it notify the other brokers.
      void distribute​(java.lang.String topic)  
      void distributeToSubscribers​(java.lang.String topic)
      it called when a new message is published, basically it distribute the message for every subscriber and eventually passe through a filter
      void execute()
      execute a task on the component after all components have been started; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been started and the component calls in turn its own inner components.
      void finalise()
      finalise the component, freeing resources that need to be, before shutting it down.
      java.lang.String getPublicationPortURI()  
      java.lang.String[] getTopics()
      get the topics available in the broker(s)
      boolean isTopic​(java.lang.String topic)
      check whether the topic is present within the broker(s).
      void modifyFilter​(java.lang.String topic, MessageFilterI newFilter, java.lang.String inboundPortURI)
      change the filter previously used in the subscription
      void notifyDestroyTopic​(java.lang.String topic)
      this method is used to notify other brokers that are in different jvm that a topic is destroyed hence update their structures
      void notifyPublish​(MessageI[] ms, java.lang.String topic)
      notify a the broker that messages were sent
      void notifyPublish​(MessageI m, java.lang.String topic)
      this method is used to notify other brokers that are in different jvm that a new message for a specific topic is published hence send it to their subscriber
      void notifyTopic​(java.lang.String topic)
      this method is used to notify other brokers that are in different jvm that a new topic is created hence update there structures
      void publish​(MessageI[] ms, java.lang.String topic)
      publish messages in a specific topic, it call the publish method behind the scene
      void publish​(MessageI[] ms, java.lang.String[] topics)
      publish messages in a specific topics, it call the publish method behind the scene
      void publish​(MessageI m, java.lang.String topic)
      publish a message in a specific topic, the idea is to start by notifying other brokers about the new message before starting distributing it to the subscriber because the the distribution is a heavy operation.
      void publish​(MessageI m, java.lang.String[] topics)
      publish a message in a specific topics, it call the publish method behind the scene
      void shutdown()
      shutdown the component; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void shutdownNow()
      shutdown the component now; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void start()
      start the component; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been initialised and the component calls in turn its own inner components.
      void subscribe​(java.lang.String[] topics, java.lang.String inboundPortURI)
      add a link between the subscriber and the topics by updating the subscriptions list
      void subscribe​(java.lang.String topic, MessageFilterI filter, java.lang.String inboundPortURI)
      add a link between the subscriber and the topic by updating the subscriptions list
      void subscribe​(java.lang.String topic, java.lang.String inboundPortURI)
      add a link between the subscriber and the topic by updating the subscriptions list
      void unsubscribe​(java.lang.String topic, java.lang.String inboundPortURI)
      unsubscribe from a topic so that the subscriber will not receive messages for that topic anymore.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws fr.sorbonne_u.components.exceptions.ComponentStartException
        Description copied from interface: fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        start the component; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been initialised and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method must always return the control.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInitialised()
 post   this.isStarted()
        Specified by:
        start in interface fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        Overrides:
        start in class fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
        Throws:
        fr.sorbonne_u.components.exceptions.ComponentStartException - todo.
        See Also:
        AbstractComponent.start()

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        execute a task on the component after all components have been started; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been started and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method can keep the control as long as they wish (contrary to start) but they need to begin by a call to super if inner components also have an execute method to be called; it is the responsibility of programmers to make sure that this does not provoke deadlocks.

        Contract

         pre    this.isStarted()
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        Overrides:
        execute in class fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
        See Also:
        ComponentI.execute()
